page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: {Raunds}is the main town in our 3 by 4 kilometre rectangle. Raunds began as an isolated village and is now a small industrial town. It is situated in a long narrow valley on the eastern bank of the larger Nene valley.The local scenery is quite delightfully rural,not having been spoilt like so many places on the western side of the river Nene by quarrying and iron works. The first historical reference to Raunds is in the Anglo-Saxon Chronicle circa 980 AD where it is listed as {"Randa"}or{"Raunde".}During the 12th century it occurs as{"Randes"}or {"Raundes".}The name is believed to be Anglo-Saxon and means edge or edges. Raunds was mentioned in the { {Domesday}book.
